page.title: 15MELSONBY-The Village Green
page.content: Unlike many English villages, Melsonby has not had a village green for very long. At the beginning of this century, much of the farmland and properties to the North of the cross-roads formed part of the {Duke {of Northumberland's Stanwick Estate. Some 10 years after the death of Eleanor, the Dowager Duchess in 1911, these estates were divided up into lots and{sold at an auction }held in {Darlington }on{6th Oct 1921.} Part of the{land (0.35 acres) }which now forms the {Green }was {Lot 50} and this was {bought by}the {Ripon Diocesan Board of {Finance}for{Â£20.}This{land was used}as the{playground}for the {C. of E. aided {school } and also included a Blacksmith's shop and other buildings. Following the{closure of the school}in {1959, }the{ land }was {bought by }the {Parish Council}for{Â£1}& made a Green.
